required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 13, 2016
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Subjective Comfort With Multipurpose Care Solutions in Soft Contact Lens Wearers
clinical_study.official_title: Subjective Comfort With Multipurpose Care Solutions in Soft Contact Lens Wearers

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to assess the comfort of OPTI-FREE RepleniSH in soft contact lens wearers.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Supportive Care

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline (Day 0) in Ocular Comfort Rating at Day 14
primary_outcome.description: Ocular comfort was rated by the participant on a continuous visual analog scale from 0-100, where 0=extremely uncomfortable, 50=neither comfortable nor uncomfortable, and 100=extremely comfortable. The participant marked a horizontal line across the scale at the point that best described, "how your eyes feel right now." A positive number indicates increased ocular comfort; a negative number indicates decreased ocular comfort.

arm_group.description: OPTI-FREE RepleniSH multipurpose solution used with study contact lenses on a daily wear basis for 14 days
ReNu Biotrue multipurpose solution used with study contact lenses on a daily wear basis for 14 days

intervention.description: FDA-approved, multipurpose solution used as indicated for cleaning, rinsing, conditioning, disinfecting, and storing study contact lenses on a daily wear basis for 14 days
FDA-approved, multipurpose solution used as indicated for cleaning, disinfecting, daily protein removing, and storing study contact lenses on a daily wear basis for 14 days
Silicone hydrogel contact lenses per subject's habitual brand and prescription worn on a daily wear basis for 14 days, with either OPTI-FREE RepleniSH or ReNu Biotrue used for contact lens care

A positive number indicates increased ocular comfort; a negative number indicates decreased ocular comfort.
outcome.population: All participants who received regimen, satisfied inclusion/exclusion criteria, and completed the 14-day treatment period (per protocol)

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected for the duration of the study.
reported_events.desc: The safety population includes all participants who received study regimen.
